contentrichtext.text: {{For|other uses of the name Dandenong|Dandenong (disambiguation)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = suburb | name = Dandenong North | city = Melbourne | state = vic | image = | caption = | lga = City of Greater Dandenong | alternative_location_map = Australia Victoria metropolitan Melbourne |longd=145.208|latd=37.959 | postcode = 3175 | pop = 21,956 (2006 census)<ref name=census2001/> | area = 9.5 | est = | stategov = [[Electoral district of Dandenong|Dandenong]], [[Electoral district of Mulgrave (Victoria)|Mulgrave]] | fedgov = [[Division of Bruce|Bruce]] | dist1 = 29 | location1= [[Melbourne city centre|Melbourne]] | dist2 = 4 | location2= [[Dandenong, Victoria|Dandenong]] | near-nw = | near-n = [[Mulgrave, Victoria|Mulgrave]] | near-ne = [[Rowville, Victoria|Rowville]] | near-w = [[Noble Park North, Victoria|Noble Park North]] | near-e = [[Endeavour Hills, Victoria|Endeavour Hills]] | near-sw = [[Noble Park, Victoria|Noble Park]] | near-s = [[Dandenong, Victoria|Dandenong]] | near-se = [[Doveton, Victoria|Doveton]] }} '''Dandenong North''' is a suburb in [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], 29 km south-east from Melbourne's [[Melbourne city centre|central business district]]. Its [[Local government areas of Victoria|local government area]] is the [[City of Greater Dandenong]]. At the [[Census in Australia#2006|2006 Census]], Dandenong North had a population of 21,965. ==History== Dandenong North Post Office opened on 18 July 1955 as the suburb was developed.<ref name = "a">{{Citation| last = Premier Postal History | title = Post Office List | url = https://www.premierpostal.com/cgi-bin/wsProd.sh/Viewpocdwrapper.p?SortBy=VIC&country= | accessdate = 11 April 2008 }}</ref> == About the suburb == Dandenong North is situated approximately 30 kilometres from the city, being very close to the [[Monash Freeway]] [[Image:Australian Alphanumeric State Route M1.svg|30px]], the road formerly known as the South Eastern Arterial & the Mulgrave freeway. There are several schools in the locality. The area was once known as Lyndale. Dandenong North is also subject to the [[EastLink, Melbourne|EastLink]] Freeway project (which connects the South-East with the Eastern Arterials). 46% of Dandenong North residents were born overseas.<ref name="census2001">{{Census 2006 AUS|id=SSC21215|name=Dandenong North (State Suburb)|accessdate=1 September 2007|quick=on}}</ref> == See also == * [[City of Dandenong]] - the former local government area of which Dandenong North was a part. ==References== {{reflist}} {{City of Greater Dandenong suburbs}} [[Category:Suburbs of Melbourne]] {{melbourne-geo-stub}}
